description: A REST API service for managing user data with authentication and real-time notifications. Built for developers who need a scalable, production-ready backend for web and mobile applications. Includes role-based access control and extensive logging.

env_variables.name: REDIS_URL
env_variables.purpose: Redis connection string for caching and sessions

env_variables.name: SECRET_KEY
env_variables.purpose: JWT token signing key (use strong random value)

modules.name: Authentication Service
modules.summary: Handles user authentication, JWT token generation and validation, and session management. Supports password-based authentication with bcrypt hashing and role-based access control.

modules.name: User Service
modules.summary: Manages user CRUD operations, profile updates, and user search functionality. Integrates with the authentication service for access control and validates all user input.

modules.name: Database Layer
modules.summary: Provides PostgreSQL connection pooling, migration management with Alembic, and ORM models using SQLAlchemy. Handles all database interactions with proper transaction management.

modules.name: Cache Layer
modules.summary: Redis-based caching for frequently accessed data, session storage, and rate limiting. Provides automatic cache invalidation and TTL management.

deployment.description: Single container deployment using Docker Compose with PostgreSQL and Redis services
Production deployment with Helm charts including autoscaling, health checks, and secrets management

faq.question: How do I reset my database?
faq.answer: Run 'docker-compose down -v' to remove volumes, then 'docker-compose up -d' to recreate with a fresh database. For production, use Alembic migrations instead.

faq.question: Why am I getting 'Connection refused' errors?
faq.answer: Ensure PostgreSQL and Redis are running. Check that DATABASE_URL and REDIS_URL environment variables point to reachable services. In Docker, use service names (postgres, redis) not localhost.

faq.question: How do I create an admin user?
faq.answer: Use the CLI command 'python -m src.cli create-admin --email admin@example.com --password yourpassword' or set the role field to 'admin' when creating a user via the API with an existing admin account.

faq.question: What's the recommended SECRET_KEY format?
faq.answer: Generate a secure random key with 'openssl rand -hex 32'. Never commit this to version control. Use different keys for development and production.

faq.question: How do I enable debug logging?
faq.answer: Set LOG_LEVEL=DEBUG in your environment variables. For production, use INFO or WARNING to reduce log volume.
